DataElement.preferredName: Patient Attenuated Live Vaccine Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator to determine patient eligibility for questions related to the receipt of any live vaccine(s) as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Attenuated Live Vaccine Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Any vaccine created by reducing the virulence of the infectious agent but still keeping the agent viable (live). In the production of an attenuated vaccine, the infectious agent is altered so that it becomes harmless or less virulent. This is in contrast to those vaccines produced by killing the pathogen (inactivated vaccine)._To take, accept, or get something offered._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Attenuated Live Vaccine Receive Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any vaccine created by reducing the virulence of the infectious agent but still keeping the agent viable (live). In the production of an attenuated vaccine, the infectious agent is altered so that it becomes harmless or less virulent. This is in contrast to those vaccines produced by killing the pathogen (inactivated vaccine).:To take, accept, or get something offered.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any vaccine created by reducing the virulence of the infectious agent but still keeping the agent viable (live). In the production of an attenuated vaccine, the infectious agent is altered so that it becomes harmless or less virulent. This is in contrast to those vaccines produced by killing the pathogen (inactivated vaccine).
To take, accept, or get something offered.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received live vac
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live vaccines and live, attenuated vaccines (prohibited for 30 days prior to study agents, during the study, and for 100 days after the last dose of study drug)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received live attenuated vaccines within 30 days of the first dose of trial treatment, is patient approved at the discretion of the investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live, attenuated vaccine within 4 weeks before Cycle 1, Day 1 or anticipation that such a live, attenuated vaccine will be required during the study and up to 5 months after the last dose of atezolizumab?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received a live vaccine within 30 days of planned treatment start?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received live attenuated vaccines within the 30 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Live Vaccine <=30 days prior to registration?
